Calculation.description: Represents a single HPP calculation performed by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the calculation entity.

productName.description: The name of the product for which HPP was calculated.

productImageUrl.description: The URL for the product's image.

materials.description: A list of material costs associated with the product.

laborCost.description: The labor cost associated with producing the product.

overhead.description: Overhead costs associated with producing the product.

packaging.description: Packaging costs associated with the product.

totalHPP.description: The total HPP calculated for the product.

suggestedPrice.description: The suggested selling price for the product.

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the calculation was performed.

definition.description: Stores user profiles. The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Auth UID.  Authorization is based on path ownership: only the authenticated user can access their own profile.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

definition.description: Stores calculation history for each user. The 'userId' parameter corresponds to the Firebase Auth UID. Authorization is based on path ownership: only the authenticated user can access their own calculations.  Includes the 'userId' field to enforce ownership invariants.

params.name: userId
params.description: The Firebase Auth UID of the user.

params.name: calcId
params.description: The unique ID of the calculation.

definition.description: Stores publicly shared calculation data. No user-identifiable information is stored here to maintain privacy. Anyone can read these calculations, but only the original user (verified via a server-side function or callable) can create/delete/modify them.

params.name: calcId
params.description: The unique ID of the public calculation.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure data isolation and facilitate efficient querying and security rule implementation for the GenHPP application.  The primary focus is on path-based ownership for user-specific data and a segregated collection for public data. This design prioritizes Authorization Independence (CRITICAL) and adheres to QAPs. The `users/{userId}/calculations/{calcId}` structure leverages path-based ownership, ensuring that calculations are owned by the respective user, simplifying security rules. The `public_calculations` collection supports the 'Community Sharing' feature, allowing users to share calculations without personal data. This segregation ensures that public data has distinct security requirements. All authorization-relevant data is denormalized, eliminating the need for `get()` calls in security rules, crucial for maintaining atomic operations and simplifying debugging.
